Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals

Class Globals

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.globals.Globals
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Globals extends Object implements Serializable
This class contains base constants for use by EMPS code.
See Also:

    • getTokens

      public static String[] getTokens(String str, String delim)
      Returns an array of string tokens from the input string str. The split delimiters are given in delim.
      Returns:
      An array of string tokens from the input string str.

    • padString

      public static String padString(String s, int len)
      Pads the input string s with additional spaces until it reaches length len. If s.length() is >= len then the input string is simply returned.
      Parameters:
      s - The input string to be padded.
      len - The length of the string on output if the input string was less than len on input.
      Returns:
      The input string padded with additional spaces up to length len. If the input string s.length() >= len then the input string is returned unchanged.

    • rightJustifyString

      public static String rightJustifyString(String s, int len)
      Pads the input string with spaces (" ") so that the entire string is len characters long and the original input string is justified to the right.
      Parameters:
      s - The input string.
      len - The output length of the returned string.
      Returns:
      The right-justified string.

    • leftJustifyString

      public static String leftJustifyString(String s, int len)
      Pads the input string with spaces (" ") so that the entire string is len characters long and the original input string is justified to the left.
      Parameters:
      s - The input string.
      len - The output length of the returned string.
      Returns:
      The left-justified string.

    • centerString

      public static String centerString(String s, int len, boolean preferAfter)
      Centers the input string in a total length string of len. If the string length exceeds len then the string is simply returned. If the string padding( before and after) is an odd number (total) then one additional space is added after if preferAfter is true. Otherwise, the additional space is added in front of the string.
      Parameters:
      s - The input string to be centered.
      len - The length of the string on output if the input string was less than len on input.
      preferAfter - If true and the padding space (before and after) sums to an odd number the additional space is added after.
      Returns:
      The input string padded with additional spaces before and after such that the total length is len on output.

    • repeat

      public static String repeat(String rep, int n)
      Repeats the input string (rep) n times and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      rep - Input string to be repeated.
      n - Number of times to repeat input sring.
      Returns:
      Input String rep repeated n times.

    • convertWinFilePathToLinux

      public static String convertWinFilePathToLinux(String inputFilePath)
      Short cut to converting windows file paths to LINUX if the platform is a LINUX platform.
      Parameters:
      inputFilePath - The path to be converted.
      Returns:
      The input path converted to a LINUX file name if it was necessary. Otherwise the original path is returned.

    • makeTable

      public static String makeTable(String hdr, String title, String rowColHdr, String[][] colHdr, Globals.TableAlignment[] colAlign, String[] rowHdr, Globals.TableAlignment rowAlign, String[][] data, int colspc)
      Text table generator. Used to build an orderly table of entries supplied by the data array. The table can have row headers and column headers including neither, either, or both. The table data columns can be aligned as can the row headers.
      Parameters:
      hdr - An extra line header printed before every line (typically just spaces.
      title - The table title.
      rowColHdr - The row/column descriptor.
      colHdr - A multi-line array of column headers. The number of rows is arbitrary but the number of columns must match that of the data array. If column headers are not desired set this parameter to null.
      colAlign - The column alignment. The number of columns must match that of the data array.
      rowHdr - An array of row headers. The number of row entries must match the number of rows in the data array. If row headers are not desired set this parameter to null.
      rowAlign - The row header column alignment setting.
      data - A two-dimensional array of data.
      colspc - An additional amount of spacing between each column.
      Returns:
      A string containing the table.

    • alignString

      public static String alignString(String s, String justHdrSpc, int len, Globals.TableAlignment align)

    • elapsedTimeString

      public static String elapsedTimeString(Date... time)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input start time (if one argument), or if there are two arguments, the time difference between time[1] - time[0]. The time string will look like "#:##:##:##:#### days" if the input time is one day or longer; "##:##:##:#### hrs" if the input time is less than a day but greater than or equal to 1 hour; "#:##:#### min" if the input time is less than an hour but greater than or equal to 1 minute; "#:#### sec" if the input time is less than 1 minute but greater than or equal to 1 second; or "# msec" if the input time is less than 1 second.
      Parameters:
      time - Array of longs = start time if one argument, = start time and end time if two arguments.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string

    • elapsedTimeString

      public static String elapsedTimeString(long... time)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input start time (if one argument), or if there are two arguments, the time difference between time[1] - time[0]. The time string will look like "#:##:##:##:#### days" if the input time is one day or longer; "##:##:##:#### hrs" if the input time is less than a day but greater than or equal to 1 hour; "#:##:#### min" if the input time is less than an hour but greater than or equal to 1 minute; "#:#### sec" if the input time is less than 1 minute but greater than or equal to 1 second; or "# msec" if the input time is less than 1 second.
      Parameters:
      time - Array of longs = start time if one argument, = start time and end time if two arguments.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string

    • timeString

      public static String timeString(long tm)
      Returns the time string from the input milisecond number. The time string will look like "#:##:##:##:#### days" if the input time is one day or longer; "##:##:##:#### hrs" if the input time is less than a day but greater than or equal to 1 hour; "#:##:#### min" if the input time is less than an hour but greater than or equal to 1 minute; "#:#### sec" if the input time is less than 1 minute but greater than or equal to 1 second; or "# msec" if the input time is less than 1 second.
      Parameters:
      tm - The input time in miliseconds.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string.

    • elapsedTimeString2

      public static String elapsedTimeString2(Date... time)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input start time (if one argument), or if there are two arguments, the time difference between time[1] - time[0]. If the input number is larger than 1 day of miliseconds then it is output as dt/1000/60/60/24 days, if larger than 1 hour it is output as dt/1000/60/60 hours, if larger than 1 minute it is output as dt/1000/60 minutes, if larger than 1 second it is output as dt/1000 seconds, otherwise it is output as dt miliseconds.
      Parameters:
      time - Array of longs = start time if one argument, = start time and end time if two arguments.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string

    • memoryUnit

      public static String memoryUnit(long mem)
      Converts the input memory value (mem) in units of bytes into a string with units of KB if mem > 1024, MB if mem > 1024^2, GB if mem > 1024^3, or TB if mem > 1024^4. The string is retuned as "x unit" where x is mem/1024^i and unit is described as above.
      Parameters:
      mem - The input memory in units of bytes.
      Returns:
      The string "x unit" where x is mem/1024^i (i=0,1,2,3, or 4) and unit is the corresponding unit bytes, KB, MB, GB, or TB.

    • elapsedTimeString2

      public static String elapsedTimeString2(long... time)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input start time (if one argument), or if there are two arguments, the time difference between time[1] - time[0]. If the input number is larger than 1 day of miliseconds then it is output as dt/1000/60/60/24 days, if larger than 1 hour it is output as dt/1000/60/60 hours, if larger than 1 minute it is output as dt/1000/60 minutes, if larger than 1 second it is output as dt/1000 seconds, otherwise it is output as dt miliseconds.
      Parameters:
      time - Array of longs = start time if one argument, = start time and end time if two arguments.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string

    • elapsedTimeString3

      public static String elapsedTimeString3(long... time)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input start time (if one argument), or if there are two arguments, the time difference between time[1] - time[0]. If the input number is larger than 1 day of miliseconds then it is output as dt/1000/60/60/24 day, if larger than 1 hour it is output as dt/1000/60/60 hr, if larger than 1 minute it is output as dt/1000/60 min, if larger than 1 second it is output as dt/1000 sec, otherwise it is output as dt msec.
      Parameters:
      time - Array of longs = start time if one argument, = start time and end time if two arguments.
      Returns:
      The equivalent time string

    • elapsedTime

      public static String elapsedTime(long startTime)
      Compute elapsed time from startTime to System.currentTimeMillis(). Input is the startTime in milliseconds. Output is either seconds, minutes, hours or days, depending on the amount of time specified.
      Parameters:
      startTime - in msec.
      Returns:
      elapsed time

    • elapsedTime

      public static String elapsedTime(double dt)
      Formats elapsed time. Input is in seconds. Output is either seconds, minutes, hours or days, depending on the amount of time specified.
      Parameters:
      dt - in seconds
      Returns:
      elapsed time

    • timeString

      public static String timeString(double dt)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input number in miliseconds. If the input number is larger than 1 day of miliseconds then it is output as dt/1000/60/60/24 days, if larger than 1 hour it is output as dt/1000/60/60 hours, if larger than 1 minute it is output as dt/1000/60 minutes, if larger than 1 second it is output as dt/1000 seconds, otherwise it is output as dt miliseconds.
      Parameters:
      dt - The input time in miliseconds to be output as days, hours, minutes, seconds, miliseconds depending on its magnitude.
      Returns:
      The formated string with units.

    • timeStringAbbrvUnits

      public static String timeStringAbbrvUnits(double dt)
      Returns the elapsed time from the input number in miliseconds. If the input number is larger than 1 day of miliseconds then it is output as dt/1000/60/60/24 days, if larger than 1 hour it is output as dt/1000/60/60 hours, if larger than 1 minute it is output as dt/1000/60 minutes, if larger than 1 second it is output as dt/1000 seconds, otherwise it is output as dt miliseconds. All units are output in abbreviated format ("msec", "sec", "min", "hr", "day").
      Parameters:
      dt - The input time in miliseconds to be output as day, hr, min, sec, msec depending on its magnitude.
      Returns:
      The formated string with abbreviated units.

    • prependLineHeader

      public static String prependLineHeader(String str, String hdr)
      Converts the multi-line string str into the same string with hdr prepended at the beginning of each line. Useful for indenting a previously constructed string that uses NL or "\n" as a line separator.
      Parameters:
      str - Multi-line string which will have hdr prepended to each line.
      hdr - Header to prepend to each line of the string.
      Returns:
      The new string with hdr prepended to each line.

    • hunt

      public static int hunt(double[] x, double xx, boolean range0, boolean rangeN)
      Find index i such that x is >= xx[i] and < xx[i+1]. If x < xx[0] returns -1 except if range0 is true return 0. If x == xx[xx.length-1] return xx.length-2 If x > xx[xx.length-1] return xx.length-1 except if rangeN is true return xx.length-2

      This method is translation from Numerical Recipes in C++.

      Parameters:
      x - array of monotonically increasing or decreasing x values
      xx - the value of x for which the index is desired.
      range0 - If x < xx[0] returns -1 except if range0 is true return 0.
      rangeN - If x > xx[xx.length-1] return xx.length-1 except if rangeN is true return xx.length-2

    • hunt

      public static int hunt(double[] x, double xx)
      Find index i such that xx is >= x[i] and < x[i+1].
      If xx < x[0] returns -1.
      If xx == x[xx.length-1] return x.length-2
      If xx > x[xx.length-1] return x.length-1

      This method is translation from Numerical Recipes in C++.

      Parameters:
      x - array of monotonically increasing or decreasing x values
      xx - the value of x for which the index is desired.
      Returns:
      the index such that xx is >= x[i] and < x[i+1].

    • hunt

      public static int hunt(float[] x, float xx)
      Find index i such that xx is >= x[i] and < x[i+1].
      If xx < x[0] returns -1.
      If xx == x[xx.length-1] return x.length-2
      If xx > x[xx.length-1] return x.length-1

      This method is translation from Numerical Recipes in C++.

      Parameters:
      x - array of monotonically increasing or decreasing x values
      xx - the value of x for which the index is desired.
      Returns:
      the index such that xx is >= x[i] and < x[i+1].

    • interpolate

      public static double interpolate(double[] x, double[] y, double xx, boolean range0, boolean rangeN)
      Interpolate a value from two 1-dimensional arrays
      Parameters:
      x - - monotonically increasing or decreasing array of input values in x direction
      y - - array of input values in y direction
      xx - - input value in x direction
      range0 - If x < xx[0] and range0 return y[0]. If x < xx[0] and range0 is false return NaN.
      rangeN - If x > xx[n-1] and rangeN return y[n-1]. If x > xx[n-1] and rangeN is false return NaN.
      Returns:
      interpolated output value in y direction

    • interpolate

      public static float interpolate(float[] x, float[] y, float xx, boolean range0, boolean rangeN)
      Interpolate a value from two 1-dimensional arrays
      Parameters:
      x - - monotonically increasing or decreasing array of input values in x direction
      y - - array of input values in y direction
      xx - - input value in x direction
      range0 - If x < xx[0] and range0 return y[0]. If x < xx[0] and range0 is false return NaN.
      rangeN - If x > xx[n-1] and rangeN return y[n-1]. If x > xx[n-1] and rangeN is false return NaN.
      Returns:
      interpolated output value in y direction

    • interpolate

      public static float interpolate(float[] x, float[] y, float xx)
      Interpolate a value from two 1-dimensional arrays
      Parameters:
      x - - monotonically increasing or decreasing array of input values in x direction
      y - - array of input values in y direction
      xx - - input value in x direction
      Returns:
      interpolated output value in y direction

    • interpolate

      public static double interpolate(double[] x, double[] y, double xx)
      Interpolate a value from two 1-dimensional arrays
      Parameters:
      x - - monotonically increasing or decreasing array of input values in x direction
      y - - array of input values in y direction
      xx - - input value in x direction
      Returns:
      interpolated output value in y direction

    • interpolate

      public static double interpolate(double[][] v, double[] x, double[] y, double xx, double yy, boolean permissive)
      Perform 2D bilateral interpolation.
      Parameters:
      v - 2D array of values that are to be interpolated
      x - 1D array of values in x direction
      y - 1D array of values in y direction
      xx - x-coordinate where interpolation is to occur
      yy - y-coordinate where interpolation is to occur
      permissive - if false and either xx or yy is out of range, NaN is returned. If true and xx or yy is out of range, a value is interpolated as if the coordinate point resided on the edge of the valid range.
      Returns:
      interpolated value or NaN.

    • interpolate

      public static double interpolate(double[][][] v, double[] x, double[] y, double[] z, double xx, double yy, double zz, boolean permissive)
      Perform 3D trilateral interpolation
      Parameters:
      v - 3D array of values that are to be interpolated
      x - 1D array of values in x direction
      y - 1D array of values in y direction
      z - 1D array of values in z direction
      xx - x-coordinate where interpolation is to occur
      yy - y-coordinate where interpolation is to occur
      zz - z-coordinate where interpolation is to occur
      permissive - if false and either xx, yy or zz is out of range, NaN is returned. If true and xx, yy or zz is out of range, a value is interpolated as if the coordinate point resided on the edge of the valid range.
      Returns:

    • conditionAz

      public static double conditionAz(double az, double na, int precision)
      If az is NaN or == na, return na. Otherwise, ensure that az is >= 0. and < 2*PI. Also ensure that az only has precision significant digits, e.g., if precision == 3, then if az = 180.123456 will be returned as 180.123000.
      Parameters:
      az -
      na -
      precision -
      Returns:

    • getNextToken

      public static String getNextToken(Scanner input)
      If the next token has any single or double quotes then the entire quoted string is returned as a token and the quotes are removed.
      Parameters:
      input - The scanner whose next token will be checked for enclosing quotes.
      Returns:
      The next scanner token with no quotes if any were originally contained.
